tit.e: Kyuchu Sekiji (Order of Precedence in the Imperial Court of Japan)
Kyuchu Sekiji (Order of Precedence in the Imperial Court of Japan)
Kyuchu Sekiji (Order of Precedence in the Imperial Court of Japan)

sen.j: 宮中席次（きゅうちゅうせきじ）とは、公的な宮中行事における席次のこと。
sen.e: Kyuchu Sekiji is the order of precedence at official events in the Imperial Court.
Kyuchu Sekiji is the order of precedence at official events in the Imperial Court.
Kyuchu Sekiji is the order of precedence at official events in the Imperial Court.

sen.j: 明治以前には公卿たちの手によって整えられた「伝統的な宮中座次」が存在した。
sen.e: Before the Meiji period, there was the 'Traditional Order of Precedence at the Imperial Court' organized by the Kugyo (a group of the most powerful men of influence in the court of the Emperor).
Before the Meiji period, there was the 'Traditional Kyuchu Zaji: Traditional Order of Precedence at the Imperial Court' organized by the Kugyo (the top court officials).
sen.cmt: 「席次」と「座次」の違いは無いと考え、英訳は'Order of precedence in the Imperial Court'にしていますが、'Kyuchu Zaji'を追記しました。Kugyoの補足説明を用語集に沿って変更しました。一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: Before the Meiji period, there was the 'Traditional Kyuchu Zaji: Traditional Order of Precedence at the Imperial Court' organized by the Kugyo (the top court officials).

sen.j: 詳細は下記「伝統的宮中座次」の節を参照。
sen.e: Refer to the following section 'Traditional Kyuchu Zaji: Traditional Order of Precedence in the Imperial Court' for further information.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。この部分は訳抜けのため追記しました。
sen.e: Refer to the following section 'Traditional Kyuchu Zaji: Traditional Order of Precedence in the Imperial Court' for further information.

sen.j: この宮中席次に類する席次表のようなものは明治時代から存在していた。
sen.e: A similar list like this order existed after the Meiji period.
The order of precedence similar to Kyuchu Sekiji existed from the Meiji period.
sen.cmt: 英文を書き換えました。
sen.e: The order of precedence similar to Kyuchu Sekiji existed from the Meiji period.

sen.j: これを1926年（大正15年）の皇室儀制令によって制度化したのがいわゆる戦前の「宮中席次」である。
sen.e: Kyuchu Sekiji' before World War II was the one written in the Koshitsu Giseirei (act that sets the ceremonies of the Imperial Court, crests of Imperial family, banners, seating arrangement in Imperial ceremonies, etc) in 1926.

Then it was systematized according to the enactment of the Koshitsu Giseirei (act that sets the ceremonies of the Imperial Court, crests of Imperial family, banners, seating arrangement in Imperial ceremonies, etc) in 1926, which is known as 'Kyuchu Sekiji' before World War II.
sen.cmt: 英文を書き換えました。
sen.e: Then it was systematized according to the enactment of the Koshitsu Giseirei (act that sets the ceremonies of the Imperial Court, crests of Imperial family, banners, seating arrangement in Imperial ceremonies, etc) in 1926, which is known as 'Kyuchu Sekiji' before World War II.

sen.j: 本来は単なる宮中行事の席次表であったが、内閣総理大臣臨時代理を設ける際に宮中席次最高位の閣僚が務めるなど、政治的意味も持つようになった。
sen.e: Originally, it was just an order of precedence at the court functions but then it started to have political meaning in events such as the top Cabinet member got promoted as the temporary representative of the Prime Minister.
Originally, it was just an order of precedence at the court functions but later it started to have political meanings in events that the top Cabinet member serve as the Acting Prime Minister.
sen.cmt: got promoted as -> serve asthe temporary representative of the Prime Minister -> Acting Prime Minister
sen.e: Originally, it was just an order of precedence at the court functions but later it started to have political meanings in events that the top Cabinet member serve as the Acting Prime Minister.

sen.j: なお、複数の席次に該当する場合は最高位のものによる。
sen.e: When they can be classed in several ranks, the highest one was thought to be their ranking.
When a person held several ranks, the order of precedence was determined according to the highest one.
sen.cmt: 英文を書き換えました。
sen.e: When a person held several ranks, the order of precedence was determined according to the highest one.

sen.j: たとえば晩年の西園寺公望は第1の大勲位、第4の元老、第7の首相前官礼遇、第16の公爵などに該当するが、第1の大勲位として扱われる。
sen.e: For example, orders of the first Daikuni (Supreme order), the fourth Genro (elder statesman), the seventh ex-Prime Minister and the 16th Koshaku (duke) applied to Kinmochi SAIONJI in his later years but he was treated as he was in the first Daikuni.

For example, although Kinmochi SAIONJI was ranked as the first Daikuni (Supreme order), the fourth Genro (elder statesman), the seventh ex-Prime Minister with courteous reception (ex-Prime Minister receives the same treatment as his previous post according to his contribution) and the 16th Koshaku (duke), only the first Daikuni was applied to his precedence.
sen.cmt: 英文を書き換えました。「首相前官礼遇」は定訳不明のため「功績に応じて退任後も以前と同じ待遇を受ける」として、英訳を追記しました。
sen.e: For example, although Kinmochi SAIONJI was ranked as the first Daikuni (Supreme order), the fourth Genro (elder statesman), the seventh ex-Prime Minister with courteous reception (ex-Prime Minister receives the same treatment as his previous post according to his contribution) and the 16th Koshaku (duke), only the first Daikuni was applied to his precedence.

sen.j: 第二次世界大戦後の1945年（昭和20年）12月には貴族院_(日本)･衆議院両院の議長が第6位に繰り上げられるなどの改正がなされたが、翌年には日本国憲法の施行とともに廃止された。
sen.e: In December 1945 after World War II, there were a few amendments such as raising the rank of both chairmen of the Kizokuin (House of Peers) and House of Representatives to the sixth; but with the enforcement of the Constitution of Japan the following year, the ranking was abolished.

In December 1945 after World War II, there were a few amendments to Kyuchu Sekiji such as raising the rank of both chairmen of the Kizokuin (House of Peers) and House of Representatives to the sixth; but with the enforcement of the Constitution of Japan the following year, the ranking was abolished.
sen.cmt: 改正は宮中席次に対して行われたと解釈し、追記しました。
sen.e: In December 1945 after World War II, there were a few amendments to Kyuchu Sekiji such as raising the rank of both chairmen of the Kizokuin (House of Peers) and House of Representatives to the sixth; but with the enforcement of the Constitution of Japan the following year, the ranking was abolished.

sen.j: ただし現在でも皇居での公式行事における政府関係者や外交団などの席次を見ると、大要でこの宮中席次の規定が踏襲されていることがわかる。
sen.e: However, looking at the order of precedence of the government officials and diplomats at official functions at the Imperial Palace today, it is clear that the rule of the order of precedence in the Imperial Court is still followed as an outline.

However, looking at the order of precedence of the government officials and diplomats at official functions in the Imperial Palace today, it is clear that the rule of the order of precedence in the Imperial Court is still used on the whole.
sen.cmt: at -> inas an outline -> on the whole
sen.e: However, looking at the order of precedence of the government officials and diplomats at official functions in the Imperial Palace today, it is clear that the rule of the order of precedence in the Imperial Court is still used on the whole.

tit.e: Traditional Order of Precedence in the Imperial Court
Traditional Kyuchu Zaji: Traditional Order of Precedence in the Imperial Court
tit.cmt: Kyuchu Zaji を追記しました。
tit.e: Traditional Kyuchu Zaji: Traditional Order of Precedence in the Imperial Court

sen.j: 明治時代以前の公家社会においても宮中座次と呼ばれるものがあった。
sen.e: Before the Meiji period, there was a thing called 'Kyuchu Sekiji' in the society of court nobles.
Before the Meiji period, there was an order of precedence called 'Kyuchu Zaji' which was used among the society of court nobles.
sen.cmt: a thing -> an order of precedenceSekiji -> Zaji
sen.e: Before the Meiji period, there was an order of precedence called 'Kyuchu Zaji' which was used among the society of court nobles.

sen.j: この伝統的宮中座次では先例と実情とが頻繁に衝突し、紛争が絶えなかった。
sen.e: In this traditional order of precedence, there were frequent collisions between historical precedence and actual conditions, which caused continuous disputes.
In this traditional order of precedence, there were perpetual discrepancies between previous and actual precedence, which caused numerous disputes.
sen.cmt: 英文を書き換えました。
sen.e: In this traditional order of precedence, there were perpetual discrepancies between previous and actual precedence, which caused numerous disputes.

sen.j: 徳川家康の禁中並公家諸法度制定の背景の一つは、この宮中座次の紛争に終止符を打つ目的だった。
sen.e: One of the purposes of the Kinchu narabini kuge shohatto (a set of regulations that applied to the emperor and the Kyoto nobles) enacted by Ieyasu TOKUGAWA, was to stop the disputes over the order of precedence at the Imperial Court.

One of the purposes of the Kinchu narabini kuge shohatto (a set of regulations that applied to the emperor and the Kyoto nobles) enacted by Ieyasu TOKUGAWA was to put an end to the disputes over the order of precedence at the Imperial Court.
sen.cmt: TOKUGAWA, -> TOKUGAWAstop -> put an end to
sen.e: One of the purposes of the Kinchu narabini kuge shohatto (a set of regulations that applied to the emperor and the Kyoto nobles) enacted by Ieyasu TOKUGAWA was to put an end to the disputes over the order of precedence at the Imperial Court.
